title: Implement async TLS operations with channel-based pattern
description:
The TLS host implementation currently returns stub errors for connect/read/write because the wasmtime Accessor pattern provides synchronous access but TlsConnectionManager methods are async.

Need to restructure similar to how callbacks work - using channels to communicate between the sync accessor context and async operations. Options:
1. Use mpsc channels like CallbackRequest pattern
2. Use Arc<Mutex<TlsConnectionManager>> with tokio spawn
3. Investigate if wasmtime has better patterns for this

This blocks the TLS functionality from actually working.
close_reason: Implemented channel-based async TLS operations. TlsRequest enum sends connect/read/write/close requests through mpsc channel to run_tls_handler which owns the TlsConnectionManager.

title: Refactor networking to eryx:net package with tcp/tls interfaces
description:
Refactor the current TLS-only networking implementation to a cleaner eryx:net package structure:

- eryx:net/tcp - Plain TCP connections (for http://localhost, internal services)
- eryx:net/tls - TLS upgrade for existing TCP connections

This enables:
1. Plain HTTP connections for local development
2. Clean separation of TCP and TLS concerns  
3. Future extensibility (UDP could be eryx:net/udp)
4. STARTTLS-style upgrade patterns

Current state: eryx:sandbox/tls@0.1.0 with TLS-only connections
close_reason: Completed: TCP/TLS separation with eryx:net package, socket shim updates, and tests
